short_summary: Replacement of current fleet of tacical vehicles for the Royal rcanadian mounted police.
description:
Trade Agreement: NONE \nTendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid \nCompetitive Procurement Strategy: N/A - P&A/LOI Only \nComprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No \nNature of Requirements: \nThe Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has a need to replace its current fleet of Tactical Armored Vehicles and is seeking interest from vendors who have the right level of expertise and experience to build and service these assets in Canada.\n\nThe objective of this Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) is to create a list of Qualified Respondents (QR) which Canada intends to use to establish solicitation(s) for a contract for the provision of TAVs (Tactical Armored Vehicles) and a Repair and Overhaul (R&O) contract for In Service Support (ISS).\n\nThis notice provides the opportunity for interested suppliers to submit their response on the Invitation to Qualify (ITQ).\nThis submission to qualify is neither a call for tender nor a Request for Proposal (RFP) and is not to be considered in any way a commitment by Canada, nor as authority to potential respondents to undertake any work that could be charged to Canada.\n\n All enquiries and other communications related to this notice, including the feedback on the this ITQ, are to be submitted in writing to the attention of the Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) Contracting Authority, using the Project�s e-mail address below: \n\nNancy.Paquette@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca\n\nCanada may, at its discretion, contact any respondents to follow up with additional questions or for clarification of any aspect of a response.\n\nCanada will not necessarily respond to questions or provide feedback on the information provided by respondents. However, of there are any questions and answers or announcements, they will be posted on buyandsell.gc.ca for all respondents.\n\n

















































































\
full_summary:
# Tactical Armored Vehicles Tender

**Icebreaker:** N/A - No trigger for ITQ response

## Trade Agreement

* Trade Agreement: NONE

## Tender Description

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has a requirement to replace its current fleet of Tactical Armored Vehicles. The desired submission is a response to the Invitation to Qualify (ITQ).

**Objective:**

The ITQ is intended to create a list of Qualified Respondents (QR) to be used for:

1. Solicitations for a contract for the provision of Tactical Armored Vehicles (TAVs) and Repair and Overhaul (R&O) services.
2. Requests from End-User Entities for In-Service Support (ISS).

**Eligibility Criteria:**
All interested suppliers must be capable and mentally competent to undertake the task.

**Responder Selection Criteria:**
No detailed criteria is mentioned. No signals are triggered for recipient to start drawing up individual requirements or for submission.

**Notice Information:**

* Publication Date: 2022-09-22
* Tender Closing Date: 2022-10-25T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2022-10-18
* Trade Agreements: NONE
* Regions of Opportunity: None
* Regions of Delivery:
  • Quebec (except NCR)
  • Prince Edward Island
  • Nova Scotia
  • Northwest Territories
  • Ontario (except NCR)
  • British Columbia
  • New Brunswick
  • Alberta
  • Yukon
  • Manitoba
  • National Capital Region (NCR)
  • Saskatchewan
  • Newfoundland and Labrador
* Contracting Entity: Public Works and Government Services Canada (TPSGC)
* End User Entities: Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP)
* Notice URL: None

## Contact Information
Nancy Paquette
nancy.paquette@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Phone: (506) 377-5065
Fax: None

### Note:
Canada does not bind itself to award a contract based on this ITQ response. Moreover, it may decide to cancel any project at any step without notice. All data collected might be passed around for purposes of possible future contracts or projects without prior notification. All the parties involved in responding to this tender will receive email updates past returned responses will not be noted. IT does not exempt potential responders from following the French and English official language law.
